text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to identify Article II of the New York Convention (duty to recognize arbitration agreements) as relevant to resisting judicial interference. The candidate answer focuses almost entirely on Article V (grounds for refusal of enforcement) and the FAA. While Article II(3) (which mandates recognition of arbitration agreements) is mentioned in the context of *Kompetenz-Kompetenz*, the response does not explicitly frame Article II as a primary argument for *resisting* the enforcement challenge based on the duty to recognize the agreement itself, which is the core of the criterion's focus. The arguments presented are primarily defenses against Article V challenges, not affirmative reliance on Article II to defeat the challenge.", "criterion_id": "8ff30d78-acbb-408c-9669-f016cc43474e"}
